option.name: Tune code for the given processor (-mtune)
Specify the name of the target architecture (-march)
Specify if floating point hardware should be used (-mfloat-abi)
Specify the name of the target floating point hardware/format (-mfpu)
Generate run time type descriptor information
Generate call instructions as indirect calls, if necessary (-mlong-calls)
Optimize for speed disregarding exact standards compliance (-Ofast)
Optimize for space rather than speed (-Os)
Place each function into its own section (-ffunction-sections)
Place data items into their own section (-fdata-sections)
Convert floating point constants to single precision constants (-fsingle-precision-constant)
Preprocess only; do not compile, assemble or link (-E)
Generate debug information in DWARF version (-gdwarf-)
Do not emit DWARF additions beyond selected version (-gstrict-dwarf)
Check for syntax errors, then stop (-fsyntax-only)
Override built-in specs with the contents of the specified file (-specs)
Read options from specified file (@)
option.tip: Aliases: @<BODY>Read additional compile options from the specified file.

option.name: C source specific flags
option.tip: Flags, listed here, would be used only when compiling C source files.

option.name: C++ source specific flags
option.tip: Flags, listed here, would be used only when compiling C++ source files.

option.name: Assembly source specific flags
option.tip: Flags, listed here, would be used only when compiling assembly source files.

option.name: Do not use the standard system startup files when linking (-nostartfiles)
Do not use the standard system libraries when linking (-nodefaultlibs)
Do not use the standard system startup files or libraries when linking (-nostdlib)
Do not link with the shared libraries (-static)
Group libraries to resolve backward references (--start-group ... --end-group)
Start with undefined reference to SYMBOL (--undefined, -u)
Assume input file is in format <bfdname> (-I, --input-target)
option.tip: Aliases: -I, --input-target<BODY>Assume input file is in format <bfdname>.

option.name: Create an output file in format <bfdname> (-O, --output-target)
option.tip: Aliases: -O, --output-target<BODY>Create an output file in format <bfdname>.

option.name: Set output arch, when input is arch-less (-B, --binary-architecture)
option.tip: Aliases: -B, --binary-architecture<BODY>Set output arch, when input is arch-less.

option.name: Copy modified/access timestamps to the output (-p, --preserve-dates)
option.tip: Aliases: -p, --preserve-dates<BODY>Copy modified/access timestamps to the output.

option.name: Remove all symbol and relocation information (-S, --strip-all)
option.tip: Aliases: -S, --strip-all<BODY>Remove all symbol and relocation information.

option.name: Remove all symbols not needed by relocations (--strip-unneeded)
option.tip: Aliases: --strip-unneeded<BODY>Remove all symbols not needed by relocations.
